question: お婆ちゃん
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>old woman</kanji> is who this is. Then, you add <ja>ちゃん</ja> for the name ender. You add <ja>お</ja> to be nicer. This person is a <vocabulary>granny</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>grandma</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>old lady</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>old woman</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading isn't the <ja>ば</ja> you learned with the kanji. It's a slightly longer <ja>ばあ</ja>, because you gotta be nice, you know? Also, the person you thought was a <vocabulary>granny</vocabulary> is actually a sheep. <reading>Baaaa</reading>! (<ja>ばあ</ja>).
